intro: Agarista chapadensis, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and tobacco. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Agarista chapadensis is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in shaded, moist environments.
